==Events==
* [[350]] &ndash; General [[Magnentius]] deposes [[List of Roman Emperors|Roman Emperor]] [[Constans]] and proclaims himself Emperor.
* [[474]] &ndash; Seven-year-old [[Leo II (emperor)|Leo II]] succeeds his maternal grandfather [[Leo I (emperor)|Leo I]] as [[Byzantine emperor]].  He died ten months later.
* [[532]] &ndash; [[Nika riots]] in [[Constantinople]] fail.
*[[1126]] &ndash; [[Emperor Huizong (Song Dynasty)|Emperor Huizong]] abdicates the [[China|Chinese]] throne in favour of his son [[Emperor Qinzong of Song|Emperor Qinzong]].
*[[1486]] &ndash; [[King Henry VII of England]] marries [[Elizabeth of York]], daughter of [[Edward IV of England|Edward IV]].
*[[1535]] &ndash; Spanish conquistador [[Francisco Pizarro]] [[History of Lima|founds Lima]], the capital of [[Peru]].
*[[1562]] &ndash; [[Pope Pius IV]] reopens the [[Council of Trent]] for its third and final session.
*[[1591]] &ndash; King [[Naresuan]] of [[Ayutthaya kingdom|Siam]] kills Crown Prince Minchit Sra of [[Burma]] in [[single combat]], for which this date is now observed as [[Royal Thai Armed Forces]] day.
*[[1670]] &ndash; [[Henry Morgan]] captures [[Panama]].
*[[1701]] &ndash; [[Friedrich I of Prussia|Frederick I]] crowns himself King of [[Prussia]] in [[Königsberg]].
*[[1778]] &ndash; [[James Cook]] is the first known [[European ethnic groups|European]] to discover the [[Hawaii|Hawaiian Islands]], which he names the "Sandwich Islands".
*[[1788]] &ndash; The first elements of the [[First Fleet]] carrying 736 convicts from [[England]] to [[Australia]] arrive at [[Botany Bay]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; [[Wesley College, Melbourne]] is established.
*[[1871]] &ndash; [[Wilhelm I of Germany]] is proclaimed the first [[List of German Kings and Emperors|German Emperor]] in the [[Hall of Mirrors (Palace of Versailles)|Hall of Mirrors]] of the [[Palace of Versailles]] ([[France]]) towards the end of the [[Franco-Prussian War]]. The empire is known as the [[Second Reich]] to Germans.
*[[1884]] &ndash; [[William Price (doctor)|Dr. William Price]] attempts to [[cremation|cremate]] the body of his infant son, Jesus Christ Price, setting a legal precedent for cremation in the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1886]] &ndash; Modern [[field hockey|hockey]] is born with the formation of The Hockey Association in [[England]].
*[[1896]] &ndash; An [[X-ray]] [[X-ray generator|generating machine]] is exhibited for the first time by H.L. Smith.
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Theodore Roosevelt]] sends a radio message to [[King Edward VII]]: the first transatlantic radio transmission originating in the United States.{{Citation needed|reason=Plaque at site says 19 Jan; 'sources vary'?|date=January 2012}}
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[Eugene B. Ely]] lands on the deck of the {{USS|Pennsylvania|ACR-4|6}} stationed in [[San Francisco Bay]], the first time an aircraft landed on a ship.
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[First Balkan War]]: A [[Hellenic Navy|Greek]] flotilla defeats the [[Ottoman Navy]] in the [[Naval Battle of Lemnos]], securing the islands of the Northern [[Aegean Sea]] for [[Greece]].
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[Japan]] issues the "[[Twenty-One Demands]]" to the [[Republic of China]] in a bid to increase its power in [[East Asia]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; A 611 [[gram]] chondrite type [[meteorite]] strikes a house near the village of Baxter in [[Stone County, Missouri]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The [[Paris Peace Conference, 1919|Paris Peace Conference]] opens in [[Palace of Versailles|Versailles]], [[France]].
*  1919   &ndash; [[Ignacy Jan Paderewski]] becomes Prime Minister of the newly independent [[Poland]].
*  1919   &ndash; [[Bentley|Bentley Motors Limited]] is founded.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: British troops [[East African Campaign (World War II)#Allied counter-offensive|launch a general counter-offensive]] against [[Italian East Africa]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[Warsaw Ghetto Uprising]]: The first uprising of [[Jew]]s in the [[Warsaw Ghetto]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; The [[Metropolitan Opera|Metropolitan Opera House]] in [[New York City]] hosts a [[jazz]] concert for the first time. The performers are [[Louis Armstrong]], [[Benny Goodman]], [[Lionel Hampton]], [[Artie Shaw]], [[Roy Eldridge]] and [[Jack Teagarden]].
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] forces liberate [[Saint Petersburg|Leningrad]], effectively ending a three-year [[Nazi]] siege, known as the [[Siege of Leningrad]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: Liberation of the [[Budapest ghetto]] by the [[Red Army]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: Liberation of [[Krakow]], [[Poland]] by the [[Red Army]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Chinese Civil War]]: [[Battle of Yijiangshan]] is fought.
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Willie O'Ree]], the first [[African Canadian]] [[National Hockey League]] player, makes his NHL debut with the [[Boston Bruins]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Capital Airlines Flight 20]] crashes into a farm in [[Charles City County, Virginia]], killing all 50 aboard, the third fatal [[Capital Airlines]] crash in as many years.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Albert DeSalvo]], the "[[Boston Strangler]]", is convicted of numerous crimes and is sentenced to life imprisonment.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[United Airlines Flight 266]] crashes into [[Santa Monica Bay]] killing all 32 passengers and six crew members.
*[[1974]] &ndash; A Disengagement of Forces agreement is signed between the [[Israel]]i and [[Egypt]]ian governments, ending conflict on the Egyptian front of the [[Yom Kippur War]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Christianity in Lebanon|Lebanese Christian]] [[militia]]s overrun [[Karantina]], [[Beirut]], [[Karantina massacre|killing at least 1,000]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; Scientists identify a previously unknown [[bacterium]] as the cause of the mysterious [[Legionellosis|Legionnaires' disease]].
*  1977   &ndash; [[Australia]]'s worst [[Granville railway disaster|rail disaster]] occurs at [[Granville, New South Wales|Granville]], [[Sydney]] killing 83.
*  1977   &ndash; [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia's]] Prime minister, [[Džemal Bijedić]], his wife and 6 others are killed in a plane crash in [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; The [[European Court of Human Rights]] finds the United Kingdom government guilty of mistreating prisoners in [[Northern Ireland]], but not guilty of [[torture]].
*  1978   &ndash; The roof structure of the [[Hartford Civic Center]] collapses after a significant snowfall.
*[[1981]] &ndash; Phil Smith and Phil Mayfield parachute off a Houston skyscraper, becoming the first two people to [[BASE jumping|BASE jump]] from objects in all four categories: buildings, antennae, spans (bridges), and earth (cliffs).
*[[1983]] &ndash; The [[International Olympic Committee]] restores [[Jim Thorpe]]'s Olympic medals to his family.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Washington, D.C.]] [[List of mayors of Washington, D.C.|Mayor]] [[Marion Barry]] is arrested for [[Psychoactive drug|drug]] possession in an [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] sting.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Martin Luther King, Jr. Day]] is officially observed for the first time in all 50 states.
*[[1994]] &ndash; The [[Cando event]], a possible [[Meteoroid#Bolide|bolide]] [[impact event|impact]] in [[Cando, Spain]]. Witnesses claim to have seen a fireball in the sky lasting for almost one minute.
*[[1997]] &ndash; In northwest [[Rwanda]], [[Hutu]] militia members kill 3 [[Spain|Spanish]] aid workers, 3 soldiers and seriously wound one other.
*  1997   &ndash; [[Børge Ousland]] of Norway becomes the first person to cross [[Antarctica]] alone and unaided.
*[[2000]] &ndash; The [[Tagish Lake (meteorite)|Tagish Lake]] meteorite impacts the [[Earth]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Sierra Leone Civil War]] is declared over.
*[[2003]] &ndash; A [[2003 Canberra bushfires|bushfire]] kills 4 people and destroys more than 500 homes in [[Canberra, Australia]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[Airbus A380]], the world's largest commercial jet, is unveiled at a ceremony in [[Toulouse, France]]
*[[2007]] &ndash; The strongest storm in the United Kingdom in 17 years kills 14 people and [[Germany]] sees the worst storm since [[1999]] with 13 deaths. [[Hurricane]] [[Kyrill (storm)|Kyrill]] causes at least 44 deaths across 20 countries in [[Western Europe]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[Gaza War]]: [[Hamas]] announces they will accept [[Israeli Defense Forces]]'s offer of a [[ceasefire]], ending the [[Gaza War|assault]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Protests against SOPA and PIPA|A series of coordinated actions]] take place in protest against [[Stop Online Piracy Act]] and [[Protect IP Act]].
